name: Golden Dragon
description: A bustling family-run spot in downtown Calgary specializing in authentic Szechuan dishes. Known for hand-pulled noodles, plump pork dumplings, and customizable spice levels that range from mild to fire-alarm hot.

name: La Piazza
description: Elegant trattoria with candlelit tables and an extensive Italian wine list. House-made pastas and wood-fired pizzas draw couples for anniversary dinners; the tiramisu is legendary.

name: Taco Loco
description: Vibrant hole-in-the-wall serving al pastor shaved fresh off the trompo. Late-night crowds line up for $3 tacos and ice-cold horchata in a no-frills, picnic-table setting.

name: Sakura Sushi
description: Sleek sushi bar with daily deliveries from the Pacific coast. Omakase menus showcase buttery toro and live scallop nigiri; the miso black cod is a signature.

name: Burger Barn
description: Retro drive-in style joint smashing Alberta beef patties on a flat-top grill. Double cheeseburgers with crispy fries and thick milkshakes keep students and families coming back.

name: Le Petit Paris
description: Intimate 30-seat bistro channeling Parisian charm. Classic escargot, duck confit, and crème brûlée paired with sommelier-selected Bordeaux; jackets recommended after 6 PM.

name: Spice Route
description: Colorful curry house offering butter chicken that simmers for six hours and flaky garlic naan baked in a 500°C tandoor. Vegan and gluten-free options abound.

name: Green Earth
description: Bright, plant-filled café crafting bowls from local organic produce. Jackfruit 'pulled pork' and cashew-cheese pizzas prove vegan food can be indulgent and guilt-free.

name: El Toro Steakhouse
description: AAA Alberta beef aged 45 days and grilled over mesquite. The 20-oz bone-in ribeye and 500-label wine cellar make this the choice for closing deals and celebrations.

name: Seaside Grill
description: Nautical-themed dining room flying in oysters daily from both coasts. Cedar-plank salmon and lobster thermidor pair with ocean-view booths (yes, even in landlocked Calgary).

name: The Greek Table
description: White-and-blue taverna with sprawling patio. Spit-roasted lamb gyros, lemony avgolemono soup, and shareable meze platters feed multi-generational Greek families every Sunday.

name: Café Aroma
description: Cozy corner café roasting beans in-house. Fluffy buttermilk pancakes, avocado toast, and almond croissants fuel remote workers camped out with laptops all morning.

name: Middle East Feast
description: Shawarma spits spin 18 hours a day. Silky hummus drizzled with olive oil, charred pita fresh from the oven, and pomegranate-glazed chicken keep the lunch rush steady.

name: Urban Thai
description: Sleek neon-lit room balancing Bangkok street heat with Calgary refinement. Khao soi curry, tear-inducing som tam, and customizable pad kee mao spice levels (1-10, daredevils choose 10).

name: BBQ Central
description: Hickory smoke rolls out the doors from 11 AM. 14-hour brisket with bark that snaps, fall-off-the-bone ribs, and cornbread soaked in honey butter; picnic tables fill fast.
